intro: Steganthera thyrsiflora, commonly known as the clustered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its clustered inflorescence and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant has a creeping or ascending habit, with hairy stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments, storing water in its fleshy stems and leaves. Steganthera thyrsiflora is often found in sandy soils and is an important component of local flora in its native habitat.
